meanings.definition: Covered in or having many prickles or thorns
meanings.sent1: The cactus in the desert was the prickliest plant around.
meanings.sent2: The hedgehog's back was the prickliest part of its body.
meanings.sent3: The prickliest bush in the garden always seemed to poke unsuspecting passersby.
meanings.sent4: Her attitude was as prickliest as a porcupine's quills.
meanings.sent5: The prickliest rose in the garden deterred anyone from picking it.

meanings.sent1: She was the prickliest person in the office, always getting upset over small things.
meanings.sent2: His prickliest mood usually came out when he was hungry.
meanings.sent3: The prickliest customer at the cafe complained about every little detail.
meanings.sent4: Her prickliest reaction to criticism surprised everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The prickliest cat in the shelter hissed at anyone who came near.

meanings.definition: Most difficult or challenging to deal with
meanings.sent1: The prickliest math problem in the assignment stumped most of the class.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with her prickliest friend required a lot of patience.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the prickliest issue in the system felt like an impossible task.
meanings.sent4: The prickliest decision of his life was choosing between two equally appealing options.
meanings.sent5: Navigating through the prickliest maze in the garden was a true test of skill.
